description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThe valley of Itajaí is located in the state of Santa Catarina, Brazil. During periods with high fluvial discharge flooding of the areas along the river margin has increasingly caused problems. During the past decades, severe flooding has occurred. This resulted in severe damage and casualties in areas such as Blumenau and Itajaí. Moreover, the high river discharges cause excessive sedimentation in the ports located along the river.In this feasibility study, the possibility was investigated to apply the Dutch Room for the River concept to the urban delta of the Itajaí-Açu river in Brazil. The river, that flooded frequently in the previous decennia, poses a severe threat to the water safety in the region. Furthermore, large flow velocities and sedimentation pose problems to the maritime navigation and port operations in the downstream section of the river. As a result, port operations need to shut down relatively often, which is not desirable for the businesses in the area.• What are the results of the projectBased on the conceptual studies and the workshop in Itajaí, Brazil, we conclude that the Room for the River concept can be applied to the Itajaí Valley to a certain extent. Despite the similarities between the low-lying deltas of the Itajaí Valley and the Netherlands, there are also differences. Some Room for the River measures focus on the summer and winter riverbed, on existing dikes or on polders. In contrast to the Netherlands these elements are non-existent in the Itajaí Valley. Moreover, most cities in the downstream river section are built adjacent to the riverbanks. Effectively taking up the space that ideally is used for the river. This reduced the number of measures suitable for the Itajaí region from 8 to 4. It has been concluded that these 4 measures can contribute to the flood resilience of the region:- River deepening / widening and the embankments (with a height relative to the ground of approximately 1 m) measures. The flood frequency would be reduced from 4 years to over 50 years.- Retention basins and river deepening / widening. The water level reduction would be in the order of 1.5 m for the design event. This would lead to an increase of the flood return period from 4 to over 50 years. - Retention basins and embankments could also be combined. The flood frequency would increase to over 50 years for embankments with a height of approx. 1.5 m.- The highwater channel on itself already reduces the flood return period to over 50 years and could be combined with any of the above-mentioned measures.Brazil has many rivers surrounded by cities and urban areas who face frequent flooding. An inventory has been made of rivers in which the Room for the River concept could be applied to improve the flood resilience. Seven rivers were identified: the Rio Iconha, Itabapoana, Paraíba do Sul, Araranguá, Jacuí, Rio Uruguay and Paraná. In all seven rivers, the occurrence of floods could potentially be reduced by implementing the room for the river concepts.
